Def.Name: Japanese Larch
Def.Description: Height at 20 years 20'; mature height 98' . Shade intolerant, min temperature -38F
Def.Leaves: Bluish-green leaves that have two conspicuous white bands below.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: Seed Cone: Erect, ovoid-conic, 2 - 3.5 cm long, with 30 - 50 reflexed seed scales. Green when immature, turning brown and opening to release the seeds when mature. The old cones commonly remain on the tree for many years, turing dull grey-black.
Def.Range: Native to Japan, in the mountains of Chubu and Kanto regions in central Honshu.
Def.Remarks: Used for rustic fencing and bonsai.
